WatchWolfComponent.name: Servers Manager
WatchWolfComponent.description: The Servers manager is the responsible for starting the servers with the desired configuration.

petitions.name: No OPeration
petitions.description: Do nothing; just send a packet.

petitions.name: Start Server
petitions.description:
This operation allows WatchWolf Tester to start a server. It provides high customization, as you can specify plugins, worlds and config files (among other parameters).
Once a 'start server' request is received the program should create a server with the specified arguments, and return its IP:Port. The IP to send the Server Petitions is the same, but the next port (IP:<port+1>).

contents.name: plugins
contents.description: Plugins to add to the server.

contents.name: world type
contents.description: Defines if the world needs to be a regular one, or superflat.

contents.name: maps
contents.description: Maps to load to the server.

contents.name: IP
contents.description:
Started server IP and port.
If it's not possible to create it (for example: one argument is invalid, the user sent a plugin when it's specified that only Usual Plugins are allowed, or there's no free servers of that type), then an empty string is returned.

AsyncReturns.name: Server Started
AsyncReturns.description: The requested server was started successfully.

AsyncReturns.name: Exception
AsyncReturns.description: The Error notification is an async petition that it is sent to the WatchWolf Tester orchestrator as a response, without any previous petition.

contents.name: exception
contents.description: Full stack trace of the raised error captured by the server console.
